snippet: Including the attack in San Bernardino, Calif., 462 people have died and 1,314 have been wounded this year in shootings that left four or more injured or dead.
abstract: Records show shootings that left four or more people wounded or dead in United States occurred an average of more than once per day in 2015, with total of 462 people killed and 1,314 wounded over year; experts disagree over whether mass killings have risen in recent years, dispute difficult to settle due to unreliability of databases that go back only couple of years; high numbers and shooting in San Bernardino, Calif, however, have intensified debate over accessibility to firearms.

byline.original: By SHARON LaFRANIERE, SARAH COHEN and RICHARD A. OPPEL Jr

lead_paragraph: Including the attack in San Bernardino, Calif., 462 people have died and 1,314 have been wounded this year in shootings that left four or more injured or dead.

headline.main: How Often Do Mass Shootings Occur? On Average, Every Day, Records Show
headline.print_headline: How Often Do Mass Shootings Occur? On Average, Every Day, Records Show
